p: Estimates of the reporting rate—the proportion of the total number of infected individuals over a specified time period that are reported as cases—range from 0.33 [ 17] to 0.83 [ 18], which bound the initial estimate by the United States Centers for Disease Control (CDC) of 0.40 [ 19]. The differences among these estimates may stem in part from the different analytical methods used, including capture recapture methods [ 17], inference from viral sequence data [ 18] and comparison of hospitalized cases with the projections of a compartmental epidemic model [ 19].
